google_play_reviews.content: ok
A goto app!
An excellent command line emulator Revealer of the language of the universe. Take course available online First learn Java and python Become illiterate and computer technology
Better than turmax 10star
Does what it says on the box
I really want to like/use the app, but not being able to change the font (or even the default terminal font isn't monospaced) is a deal breaker.

It's literally the only fully feature open source ssh client for Android. It may have some bugs as stated below (the only one I found is when using "screen") but it's a free app supported by the community. Lovely project
Fast, small, great features - works as intended
Very impressive. Small size, several options. I manage to install a home server for home on a raspberry pi remotely. The best of the best!

Can't add widget shortcuts on android 13. Other than that it's my go to SSH client. No ads, no spam. It's streamlined but fully functional. Post-login automation to execute scripts and commands is very useful.
good
Op hakeing plet form
Works great on my Cat S42, but on this Samsung A13 the cursor is too far right of the text entered.
No ads no stupi d subscription plans. Nopremium whatever options. Just does its job. Maybe the cursor csn be better because it seems a little bit shifted
Uses a proportional font for some reason.
Open source, fully functional and easy to use.
Excellent but lacks mouse input support. I need this for some terminal apps like Midnight Commander.

It's an SSH client. A very necessary thing. But it has a fatal flaw -- Android devices are fantastic except for when it comes to typing. Use an external keyboard with this app and it doesn't recognize vital keys (such as CTRL). If you're willing work with the on-screen keyboard and use the terrible multi-keypress workarounds to use non-alphabet keys then this will work for you.
it was so easy to use. was able to shutdown my linux server using the post-login automation in about 10 minutes.

v1.9.9 repeatedly spontaneously crashes, producing a pop-up notification stating that the software has a bug and I should install the next version when it is released. Segmentation fault, perhaps? Please fix this so I can rate five stars for what is otherwise a great app! Thank you!
Been using for 6+ years. Still my favorite for Android. Simple & flexible.
Real application for configuration on devices through all platforms. Most apps simplify the layout with minimal actions and pretend it gets the job done.. mostly through another party.
Awesome. I have tried many terminals, but Noone worked. But this one is working perfectly.
Good app, helped me!
Just love this app. I use it to manage my server when I'm not at home. It's much easier to make a ssh connection with this app than with a terminal.
Works ok but cursor does not line up with where you are typing which makes editing a little difficult.
Very useful, very good app. Regarding my previous complaint about public keys, I was using them wrong, my bad.
Not usable on Galaxy Tab S8+ due to large screen size. Remote host's log show connection is successful but screen goes black.
ConnectBot is a necessary App.

Port forwarding doesn't seem to release its ports on connection close or on tapping in the list, and changing them in that state causes a hang and force close. Local connections have no local directory (permissions) and can't contact the package manager or other adb-shell things.
Good app, just needs a proxy option.
Very good app

It doesn't spam you with a bunch of ads you'll never intentionally click, so that alone is worth four stars. It would be five stars, but it's a little buggy. But it's free, it's actively supported, and It Just Works. I use this almost daily. The other recentreviews are worth reading to understand what you'll get. I do wish the row of extra keys was configurable, and I wish Enter was one of them (I frequently will up-arrow and enter to re-run a command), but you're crazy if you use anything else.
Glad this is back under development. Needs some fixes though.
I don't have any experience but I know this app will work just as find
No Documentation. I can't find the features I need.

I have tried several of these ssh terminal programs and this is the best one so far üôÇ. Hint: go to settings and enable "always show special keys". Otherwise it hides what you are trying to type. Also the tab key is a bit finicky I wish it were bigger I keep hitting the key next to it.

Not sure why anybody would use a different telnet/ssh tool on Android. This is the only one worth using. It's got a couple things I don't like (text entry cursor indicated position vs actual character position synchronization is bad, gets further and further apart with the right side of the screen on several phone models), and it won't accept some officially permitted punctuation characters in domain names, so you can't use it to connect to those services unless you know the IP address.
So so
Still a great piece of software.
Wow, great tool.
Keystrokes don't show on screen. Unable to use app at all.
does not support jump hosts, otherwise, great
does not connect to my Debian 12 box complaining key exchange couldn't complete due to mismatched proposal. I wish the app could provide a debugging view to let me diagnose the issue.
Simple & reliable. If you like putty, this app will make Android access just as easy.
Unfortunately (and apparently) doesn't support ProxyJump. If it had that ability (and the possibility to port forwarding on the host config) could be a more useful tool than already is.
No way to transfer accounts. Poor inputs compared to Nestbox and termux. No sftp. No file storage android integration.
Regards
Very useful for command line access to systems from a phone. Particularly pleased that it is open source
very helpfull app for quick acces to linux machines, but i could not get to authenticate with private key, i am assuming its not supported but if yes then please let me know
Resizing issue in landscape mode. Every time it's freezing.
Cursor is 4 spaces away from where it should be - no matter the terminal setting.
Well soon see
Wow
i can't type anything******
how do I connect to host...

I checked your guys' website, I checked the description, I even looked the app up on YouTube. Nothing I could find gave me a list of commands that the shell of my Motorola Edge plus 5G UW (2022) would recognize. It even rejected the 1s command. Either I got a badly bugged download or there's something wrong.

Bad. Always disconnected because of my connection termination. But my wifi is still working. Can you fix it. The wifi termination is fake.

Small and fast SSH client

Several reproductible bugs and terminology mistakes; at least its xterm emulation is better than Termius! However, it seems to be only 1 of 2 options for an SSH terminal on Android since JuiceSSH seems dead in the water. Where and how do we report bugs?
Very first app I download on the Droid. Still my go to school client. Works great. Open source. Ad free. Thanks.
User friendly good to working now
Connects but cannot use enter for some reason so it's unusable to me.
üîë Jeff Sharkey is the Key
Works perfectly.
I like the easy UI allowing quick connections to known servers. ConnectBot works fine most of the time, but is rather sensitive to network hickups compared to other clients
I used it for hacking it was quite good
The best ever
When pushing the arrow-keys I geht a pretty strong vibration - can I turn this off? Finally found the control-button: it's in the top LEFT corner :D

No problems on my Samsung phone, very convenient, everything I could want in an ssh app. However, on my new Motorola phone, the terminal font is variable-sized, not monospace! This makes it not usable for a lot of things (such as running a text editor). Likely Motorola's fault for not providing a default monospace font. However, other terminal apps such as Termux work fine so there are clearly workarounds you could do.
This app is Useless
Loving this app, I can load up multiple python apps on Raspberry Pi and run them from phone. THANK YOU
Does not open on pixel 6 pro running A12.
The best ssh client I've ever used on Android! Please add the remember password feature.

Gets the job done, but port forwarding is really laggy, even with compression. This is a connectbot issue since I don't experience this when establishing a local tunnel with other applications to the same server. Lag is observed when using VNC over SSH.
Only SSH client that is simple, easy to understand and not loaded with eye candy. It worked right away where others took configuration per pc basis. I love this client
Not supporting key system. Bot useful for AWS
Best ssh client for Android out there
Perfectly simple ssh client. I wouldn't change a thing.
Works great
Nice üëç
Just amazing, I can now stop taking laptop to every places I go for few scripting run.

A competent enough ssh client, but the key overlay that provides esc, ctrl, arrows etc when you tap the console area obscures the command you're typing if you're at the last line of the terminal (which is most of the time in my experience). Deeply frustrating.
Very good I like how this app has the text size feature.
I've been searching for this. So finally
I love the freedom from ads and the on screen keys for navigation, &c.
Generally works ok. Copy and paste seems to be an issue. Can paste ok but cant copy text in normal way. Long press causes disconnect
Works great, just as it always has, freely and without ads! I wish there was a soft-alt/meta to go with the other keys.
Unfortunately trying to edit a text is impossible as the ctrl button doesn't work when trying to exit nano. Ok for commanfrom the command line, however.
Cut and paste is not usable on my setup. Highlighted text does not correspond to what is cut. On Samsung Dex.
Great feel. Okay keyboard, but could use improvements similar to JuiceSSH. No SFTP. No switching to internal IP when within LAN. Yes shortcut on Home screen.
AMAZING
Thanks for this brilliant add-free app, works as charm.
Simple, elegant and great for connecting to my raspberry pi.

Nice, simple, functional, free and no ads! Have 5 big stars my friend. Thank you for your selfless contribution to the community. My only suggesstion would be to add a facility to remember passwords. Thanks again.
Did someone forget the ALT key???
Great app, use it all the time.

Random hard disconnects in the middle of typing a command (Pixel 3). Lots of promise, but unusable for me.
Searching for mosh shows this app, but it doesn't do mosh
Was great.....,but No longer can use, after updating to Ubuntu 22.04 the minimum ciphers provided by this app no longer work.
This used to work great but now using screen in a ssh session causes this app to instantly crash
Almost perfect, would be great if basic SCP support and the ability to open multiple shell sessions to a single host, were added
Works with no issues so far!
I've already put my review once, must have gotten lost. It gets the job done
It works!! Want to authenticate using keys? No problem, easily create or import private/public keys. Create port forwardings so you can tunnel your we browser. What else do you need?
Simply not working. Screen goes blank after password prompt.
Almost perfect. The copy/paste mechanism is broken and near impossible to use.
Great little app, thank you Devs! Enables me to connect to a SBC on my network from my tablet to update etc. Very helpful.
Session tabs is great! Doesn't draw Midnight Commander properly and doesn't send function keys to it either.

There is a lot of good ideas in this app. But - I don't know why - the font used on my phone is not monospaced. It is proportional and everything looks bad (alignment issues, some characters are partially eaten...). I think if the app let us choose the font for the console, it would solve my problem (for instance I would choose the "FiraCode NF" as I did for a competitor app, JuiceSSH)
Can't paste from my clipboard, so cannot paste secure passwords
Works and Free!
Only terminal emulator that works nicely with mouse and keyboard!
During session, cursor at times is positioned away from where it actually should be. After pressing enter, instead of a line return the cursor will reposition to the beginning of the same line.
There is no shift button. Shift key is useful for doing many things. Please add a shift key. Thank you.
Imei holder /project god

This tiny app might not be the most feature-rich ssh client on android, but it has never failed me. I would install this over any of the others on every occasion without a second thought, just for doing what it needs to do, without ads or bs clutter of any kind. Nicely done
Hi. The curser is misplaced badly Its very hard to type commands etc. Is there a fix? Ove plus 7 pro and swiftkey

Haven't used it too much just yet, but the fact that it connected to my file server immediately without any, ANY, issues, I'm giving it 5 stars. I do most of my admin work with ssh sessions (not a GUI person) so this is great for me.
Abandonware. Access to media files only? Are you joking?
Best app for what it's intended. I'm able to access and manage my Linux machine on my android device from anywhere with internet access. Also does not crash or have ads. What more can you ask for?

I really wanted a simple SSH client for Chrome tablet and this is _almost_ perfect. The big problem is it doesn't support screen rotation! When my tablet case is in "flat" position (volume buttons at the bottom) it's ok but when my tablet case is in "upgright" position (volume buttons at the top) then ConnectBot is upside down!!! See issue 509 on GitHub.
This app deserves 5star rating overall. Simply nice and helpful, thanks to the team. Keep updated! üëè

Can't add hosts on a Samsung Tab S7+, the UI only shows the protocol type, the rest of the options are not accessible. Edit: if you allow screen rotation then UI works in landscape. Still a pain, changing to 3 stars.
Putty SSH without the annoying ads. Thank you. Boyfriend is here.
Wow, just wow.
It's connectbot. Nuff said.

I'd give it 5 stars if it could import ssh keys in a reasonable way (just look at how putty/winscp do it on windows or file manager+ in android). Unfortunately, I have to look for another ssh client that supports ssh keys.

Ok but the keyboard covers the active screen so can't see what I type even.
Works, no issues or comments. It just works well.

Excellent tool to have.
Always trying port23 even if I change it still 23

Long time user, love this app! However, I just noticed that it wont correctly import key pairs created with putty, "problem parsing imported private key" error message and key shows up as "unknown format" in pubkeys. This used to work so I'm not sure what happened. Thanks for your help!

Works great when connected. Please add a disconnect all widget. I use the widget to connect but if there was a previous connection that was disconnected it just opens that window and does not connect agsin. You have to first be disconnected.
A PuTTy-like terminal for Android.
I use an Android tablet with a BT physical keyboard. The forced rotation into portrait mode and the fixed on-screen keyboard mean that this otherwise rather nice app is utterly unusable.
Nice app
Easy to use and works well!
this app is lack of terminal basic function such as arrow keys, escape and control
Awesome app Features like reconnecting and saving session like kitty are very good
Very good. Well done. Just need a help document to be added.

An essential app, one of the first installed on any new device. Manage a bunch of Pi's and a PC with ConnectBot. Used it for years and can't see me ever changing. I just wish it could trigger replacing the emoji symbol with the / on Gboard like browsers do, but that's being picky.
Cool
Great app, no issues with kb auth on my redmi X3

Excellent terminal for remote login of headless Linux systems
good app
Fantastic SSH client! Thanks for making it work with Mikrotik routers.

very good program. Works fine. What I miss is a way to export and import all my connections. Therefore I do almost all my terminal sessions in "Asbru" on my linux PC. (Asbru can also do X sessions what Connectbot can not)
Connects well. Good app.

No longer usable for new Servers as the developer doesn't update the App in Play Store even when the bug was fixed on the GitHub Repo for over a Year. Edit: newly uploaded version now works. So that was a fast reaction by the developers. Still would have preferred if it would have worked without the need to complain.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Sorry to hear you were having issues. Try the recently released 1.9.8 version and see if it solves your problem.

google_play_reviews.content: Nice app, but there is a strange issue when I use a portuguese layout bluetooth keyboard. When I type an accent (', ^) it kind of sticks and this accent keeps appearing wether I type space or any letter that can be accented. Doesn't happen without that external keyboard, and doesn't happen when I use other apps with that keyboard.

It was working fine. Now crashes upon attempt to connect with a Divided by Zero exception or something. No clue why. I have to resort to Termux which is a more manual process. I updated to latest nonbeta and it still happens. Uninstall reinstall nothing still works. My phone was FACTORY reset and connect or worked again. could've been an LG issue would've like to debug and fix tho but couldn't. bumped up 1 star
Best FREE & Open Source SSH client for Android. And only takes 1.74 MB!
Excellent job.
My favourite SSH app to use on Android.
SSH. It works

GSSAPI/Kerberos support and an equivalent to ProxyJump would be useful additions. Edit: the recent addition of softkeys (arrows and tab) in portrait mode is very useful. Would bump to 4.5 if allowed...
I really like this app, how it functions, features, etc. Have had it for years. However, it's now disconnecting me frequently, and crashing. Bummed. I'm on Pixel 4.
lightweight.

Great simple app, works fine for my simple need to connect and run some monitoring script on Buster. It works in portrait mode only and there is option to force resize display for more width but then font will become smaller. Since keyboard is crucial in terminal, it is understandable that it runs in portrait mode as half the screen is needed for keyboard.
An essential part of my daily workflow.
It does so much you wanna connect with your enemy just to try it...lol... thx

A quick look and I was impressed! But the inability to operate in landscape/wide mode means most lines are wrapped, and I can't live with that. So without further assessment, I must uninstall and keep looking.

always activates password Input field when login was successful. entering commands are not possible, because it still is entered as password in password field (which is not removed). also missing important easy access to shell characters like pipe, slash, tilde, $....

Overall, I have to say that this app is both simple, and reliable, most importantly, very useful. One feature that perhaps developers could consider adding in the not too distant future would be allowing the screen to unlock/rotate into landscape mode, which would make console operations with long command-strings easier to read for sys-admins and programmers. Keep up the good work, gang.

This is the only android ssh client that I have found to work consistently over time. I wish it had key management functionality (ssh-keygen, ssh-copy-id)
I've been using this app for the last couple of years. And, even today i friendly believe that this is a must-have app for anybody who administers a site!

It's the best ssh tool I've found on Android. What I don't get: why is it so hard to detect a tunnel broken due to temporary network failures or a change in IP address? I always need to go in, select "yes" and have it reconnect. If that was automatic in the background it would be a clean-cut five star. Update: after hardening the security of my private ssh server I cannot connect with this app anymore because its support for keyexchange and MAC algorithms seems outdated.

Perfect app for what I wanted. It's a lightweight ssh client, no unwanted notifications, no in-app purchases, no garbage at all, just an ssh client that works very well.

I use this app to ssh into a couple of Linux boxes and for this it does everything I could need. The reason I can't give it five stars though is because of the "special keys" bar. When you have a full screen of text the bar covers the input line and so you can not see what you type and personally I find the keys too small. Trying to use the arrow keys is very awkward and I find it is so easy to hit the wrong one. It is still my prefered ssh client though
awesome

A very good remote terminal connection application. No ads or anything annoying. If an sftp functionality is also added, it will be very useful. Another missing feature is the "SSH Keep Alive" option to prevent timeouting TCP connections.
My go-to app for debugging on the go. Never had any issues so far.

ConnectBot makes it simple to ssh in to my Raspberry Pis at home from my phone and tablet. Generates its own ssh keys that can be exported easily if needed. Extra keyboard elements make it easy to tab-complete and arrow-up to reduce typing. Good stuff.
Performed exactly as I expected on my Google Pixel XL running Android Q Beta, even behind a public firewall!

Great client, works every rime.

Out of all the SSH clients available for android, this is by far my favorite, and the only one ill use. I use a Galaxy S Relay 4G with a slide out QWERTY keyboard. None of the other clients are completly compatible. ConnectBot works perfectly with it. Other features I find important and are included are VT100 emulation including graphic characters, complete control of text colors, screen size, and font size. Special keys take up very small part of screen when displayed. no ads, free, and more!
this is a good application, i can connect to ssh server using a rsa key, and the port forwarding works very well, recommended.
When using the telnet option, it told me i have never connected, even if i did connect

Very good, but cannot back it up with adb to transfer my hosts to a new device. Can you put android:allowBackup="true" in the app manifest? It allows Google's automatic data backup, so when you restore apps while setting a new phone, the app data gets restored from the cloud. It also allows adb backup to work.

It does not allow to use keys on Android 9 any more. You have to use passwords only.. I mean you cteate your keys, upload them, but it always fails to connect and wants passwords.. too bad.. or is that a bug? All the other clients of mine connect perfectly fine on keys, except for connect bot. Update: I found the issue. ConnectBot copies public keys instead of private keys and vise versa, it places private keys instead of public ones. Switch them the other way around. It solved my problem.

This app does exactly what it's supposed to do. Well at least for ssh,  that's all I use it for. There is one or two things I can think of that would make this app better.  The special character tool bar covers the terminal prompt. I have auto hide on, but that isn't useful while I'm using the bar.  When you tap the screen to unhide the bar you could scroll back the terminal a few lines or leave a buffer between where the bar and prompt are.  And then there is scrolling vs copy/paste. Dragging your finger up or down on an area containing no text should never trigger the copy/paste option. It should just scroll the screen. Period. Maybe adding a dedicated scroll bar would help, although just fixing the intended functionality would be preferable.   Thank you for an otherwise very useful app. 5‚òÜ's when these issues are fixed.
Dont Use.. Try Domething Else... typing is a mess...
Worked great before.  Now it won't import public keys.  Keeps saying "wrong password" and "unknown format."

I used to use this when I had an old Linux version on my PC that did not support MTP for my phone and it worked great for connecting to Linux or a NetBSD shell account I have on the Internet, etc.  But since I upgraded from a Samsung S3 to J7 this app does not even appear to have any way to allow me to add my ssh key that I need to use to connect to my Linux desktop PC or anything else (I normally disallow passwords in Linux to require keys only). When I try to "Manage Pubkeys" it says 'Tap"Menu" button to create or import key pairs', but where in the world is a "Menu" button on an Android (6.0.1) phone? When I try More > Import, it says "Pick from /sdcard", but the only choice is "Cancel". So it used to work great, but is now totally useless for anyone who wants or needs to use keys instead of passwords, since there is no way to select a key file from internal storage or microSD (sdcard). So while I used to like this app, it is currently non-functional for me at this time.

This app works like a champ. I've been using it on all my android phones. I've been using this app for years, and its excellent. Recently, I started getting host key exchange errors and what appears to be a message indicating the connection was closed before the key exchange was complete. Usually, trying the same connection again fixes the issue, but it's pretty annoying, and used to work great. Still a 4+ star app, 5 if they can fix this new bug!

Solid SSH client; I rely on it every day.

Seems that the key exchange problem has somewhat morphed in version 1.8.4.  Now, periodically, the following message appears: "Hostkey signature sent by remote is wrong!"  Usually, another attempt resolves the issue.  Itseems less chronic than the prior signed/unsigned shared secret encoding, but is still occurring nonetheless. (prior review follows)...   For those suffering with the message "Key exchange was not finished, connection is closed." when attempting to connect to a server -- try repeatedly connecting.  It appears that there is a bug in 1.8.3 that causes this when the shared secret is encoded as a negative value.  Subsequent connections will eventually work (provided that rules on your server do not blacklist you first).  It appears that the bug has been fixed by the developers but has yet to be released.  A small blemish on an otherwise great app.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the public service announcemeunt. The fix for this was released in 1.8.4. :)

google_play_reviews.content: Port forwarding is utterly broken in the latest version. Whenever you use that to forward a http port and switch to any other browser, Connect boyt simply drops the connection in the background. Going back to Connect Bot simply gives a dead ssh session. Tried different servers to no avail... shame, used to be a great app.

Simple yet effective ssh client. No fancy crap, only job getting done.
Works very well.  Unlike another SSH client, this actually uses a fixed width font.  Moreover, it can generate and use key pairs that allow disabling password authentication.  Superb program.

This app has made it extremely easy to make wake on lan and sleep on lan work in my situation. The best feature is the auto run after login commands, you can make simple scripts so you don't have to do any typing (for me it's to send a wakeup packet or run a couple powershell commands to sleep my computer). It's a little finicky with puttygen private keys, but that's easily solved by generating the keys in the app.
V1.8 through 1.8.3 were useless to me. Couldn't connect or hold a connection. 1.8.4 gave me access. Everthing I loved about this app I have again.
